intro: Alsine pharnaceoides, commonly known as the common sandparsley, is a low-growing annual herb native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It typically reaches heights of 10–30 cm and has hairy, branching stems. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom from June to September. Its leaves are alternate, linear to lanceolate, and often have a rough texture. Alsine pharnaceoides thrives in sandy or disturbed soils and is often found in coastal areas and dry habitats.
